citation.article-title: Muricauda flavescens sp. nov. and Muricauda aquimarina sp. nov., isolated from a salt lake near Hwajinpo Beach of the East Sea in Korea, and emended description of the genus Muricauda
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Muricauda Bruns et al. 2001
The description is as given previously (Bruns et al., 2001), with the following amendments.
Optimal growth occurs between 20 and 30 °C or between 30 and 37 °C.
The fatty acid profile is characterized by large amounts of branched and straight-chain fatty acids.
The DNA G+C content is 41–45 mol%.
